page.title: 01South Kyme
page.content: South Kyme is a small village set in a large, productive arable farming area. Farming dominates the work and quiet life style of the community. The village is isolated; the nearest small town being Sleaford (9miles). Built beside the site of the old abbey and tower, it is divided by the Kyme Eau river (River Slea). One hump back bridge remains, a legacy from days when crops were transported by river. There are very few amenities in the village, which is by no means self sufficient. There is one pub, one shop/Post Office, a village hall, chapel, and church. The community was wounded when the village primary school was closed, in 1984. Some members of long-standing, local families reside here, but there are several newcomers who commute to work, or who have retired in the village.
